column13: Not actually recommended in spite of profound hearing loss in high tone bilaterally and ongoing difficulty with ‘ inadequate’ HA. Audiologists just did not recommend, there is a strong market for hearing aids that don’t require surgery, because the buyer does not know that audioligists are selling a certain HA rather than getting the best thing for kind of deafness a person has. Hearing loss is very individual, mine is a ski slope loss. Almost normal at 125 kHz but none at 4000 kHz , yet I was being sold HA that magnified up to 8000khz, no use at all. The first person who bothered to explain and was honest was the surgeon who did the CI, up to then, the audiologists kept saying you need better HA’s. I  had noticed a drop in my hearing availing and it coincided with a performance satisfaction survey. I was fed up and filled it in saying it does not matter how well you are performing because the bottom line in, I can’t bloody hear! I got a ph call, they did a test, noticed further loss at 2000khz and recommended CI. I went straight in.
